title: Library preparation from a single amplicon pool
title_html: Library preparation from a single amplicon pool

protocol.title: Library preparation from a single amplicon pool
protocol.title_html: Library preparation from a single amplicon pool

source.description:
Set up the following reaction for each sample:
Component Volume
DNA amplicons (5ng/ul)
Nuclease-free water
Ultra II End Prep Reaction Buffer
Ultra II End Prep Enzyme Mix
Total

Incubate at room temperature for
Incubate at
for
Incubate on ice for
Quantify the barcoded amplicon pools using the Quantus Fluorometer using the ONE dsDNA assay.

source.title: DNA quantification using the Quantus fluorometer

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":30}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8sqrn","text":"Set up the required number of   tubes for the number of DNA samples to be quantified.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"40p93","text":" ","type":"atomic"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fqt09","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5l06k","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","data":{"amount":"0.5","guid":"0AFE7430E05911E98812198048CE0C80","id":0,"label":"","unit":2}},{"type":"notes","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d1gbo","text":"Use only thin-wall, clear, 0.5mL PCR tubes such as Axygen #PCR-05-C","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"ED52A0F0E05811E98812198048CE0C80"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d3qaq","text":"On the Home screen of the Quantus Fluorometer, select `Protocol`, then select `ONE DNA` as the assay type.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"sac5","text":" ","type":"atomic"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b175n","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9j7c3","text":"If you have already performed a calibration for the selected assay you can continue, there is no need to perform repeat calibrations when using ONE DNA pre diluted dye solution. If you want to use the previous calibration, skip to step 11. Otherwise, continue with step 9.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"12969380E05911E98812198048CE0C80"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":11}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2v9ue","text":"Set up two   tubes for the calibration and label them 'Blank' and 'Standard'","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f4117","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","data":{"amount":"0.5","guid":"F9BF04A0E05811E98812198048CE0C80","id":0,"label":"","unit":2}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"33ltu","text":"Selection 'Calibrate' then 'ONE DNA' then place the blank sample in the reader then select 'Read Blank'. Now place the standard in the reader and select 'Read Std'.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":61}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7i9b2","text":"On the home screen navigate to 'Sample Volume' and set it to  then 'Units' and set it to ng\/\u00b5L.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e1oh5","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","data":{"amount":"1","guid":"1A82D300E06911E9879DDDC406CE84AC","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b42g5","text":"Load the first sample into the reader and close the lid. The sample concentration is automatically read when you close the lid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6sb3l","text":"Repeat step 16 until all samples have been read.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"abfuk","text":"The value displayed on the screen is the dsDNA concentration in ng\/\u00b5L, carefully record all results in a spreadsheet or laboratory notebook.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7411v","text":"Remove Lambda DNA 400 ng\/\u00b5L standard from the freezer and leave on ice to thaw. Remove ONE dsDNA dye solution from the fridge and allow to come to room temperature.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9otgf","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"amolm","text":" ","type":"atomic"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"chpe3","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"63ekk","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5oeus","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[{"type":"reagents","data":{"_public":"","align":"","can_edit":0,"cas_number":"","guid":"678D6B60E06911E9879DDDC406CE84AC","id":42947,"linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"QuantiFluor(R) ONE dsDNA System, 500rxn","public":0,"reagent_vendor_link":"","rrid":"","sku":"E4870","stats":{"total_protocols":0},"url":"","vendor":{"name":"Promega","affiliation":null,"affiliations":[],"username":null,"link":"http:\/\/www.promega.com","image":{"source":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io\/img\/vendors\/placeholder.png","placeholder":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io\/img\/vendors\/placeholder.png"},"badges":[],"research_interests":null,"blocked_by_you":false,"blocked_you":false,"hide_following":false,"id":23}}}]}

source.description:
Set up the following AMII adapter ligation reaction:
Component Volume
End-repaired amplicon pools
Ligation Buffer (LNB)
Adapter Mix (AMX)
Quick T4 DNA Ligase
Total

source.body: There will be some variation in clean-up efficiencies but expect to carry around 80% through a clean-up.

source.description: Incubate at room temperature for

Add
(1:1) of SPRI beads to the sample tube and mix gently by either flicking or pipetting.

source.body: Vortex SPRI beads thoroughly before use to ensure they are well resuspended, the solution should be a homogenous brown colour.

source.description: Pulse centrifuge to collect all liquid at the bottom of the tube.

Incubate for
at room temperature.

Place on magnetic rack and incubate for
or until the beads have pelleted and the supernatant is completely clear.
Carefully remove and discard the supernatant, being careful not to touch the bead pellet.

Add
SFB and resuspend beads completely by pipette mixing.

source.body: SFB will remove excess adapter without damaging the adapter-protein complexes. Do not use 70% ethanol as in early clean-ups.

source.description: Pulse centrifuge to collect all liquid at the bottom of the tube.
Remove supernatant and discard.
Repeat steps 14-16 to perform a second SFB wash.
Pulse centrifuge and remove any residual SFB.

source.body: You do not need to allow to air dry with SFB washes.

source.description:
Add
EB and resuspend beads by pipette mixing.

Incubate at room temperature for
.
Place on magnetic rack.
Transfer final library to a new 1.5mL Eppendorf tube.
Clean-up end-repair reaction using 1x SPRI beads

description: This is a subprotocol for generating a library from a single amplicon pool
